page.title: 03NATURAL HISTORY 01161651
page.content: The area consists of{Lewisian Gneiss } with coastal faults of{Hornblende {Schist}and includes a fairly large area of peat which is still cut by hand and used by the local inhabitants for fuel.The land is low-lying with small hills rising to some thirty metres and enjoys a warm climate due to the{Gulf Stream}.Annual rainfall is between 47"and 63". The coastal area consists of lush meadows and arable land.In the former orchids abound,whilst around the rocky coast the sea-sprayed turf supports an interesting flora with{Brookweed,Bog {Pimpernel,Sea Holly,Grass of Parnassus and many{Eyebright}species. Sea birds abound and the{Chough}breeds here.The reservoir supplying water to both villages is a haven for dragonflies,butterflies,grasshoppers and many other insects.
